intro: Goodenia hilliana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved goodenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Goodenia hilliana is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in native garden landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
